Thank you again and we look forward to your next visit with us.  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary: The Alpine Inn was the perfect place for my family of four (two under the age of 4 years) to stay on an overnight to Disneyland.  We were not looking for a resort-type experience; those who are will be highly disappointed.  However, the Inn is perfect for people who simply want a safe, inexpensive, hospitable, and easy experience.  We found the rooms to be well-kept, clean, spacious and, most importantly, quiet.  The staff was very friendly and the free parking was a wonderful bonus.  The location could not be better, as the Inn shares a wall with the back end of Cars Land at California Adventure.  Those who are interested in walking to the Parks can do so; the Grand Californian, which you can cut through to get to Downtown Disney, is about 10 minutes walking distance.  There is
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for your review. Traveling with small children, a convenient location is a must. Situated right behind the Cars Land of California Adventure Park, you will enjoy the excitement during the day and yet quiet and peaceful nights to help you recovering from an all day fun at the parks.  With our friendly service, affordable rate and clean rooms, we welcome your to visit us soon. Thank you.  Warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary Heading: Excellent service. Friendly & consultative staff. Excellent location
Summary: We came from NY. Checked in easy. Friendly greetings.  All 5 different members on different shifts were friendly and helpful. So that's not just a coincidence that I met someone nice.  All 5 were nice. Price was excellent for clean room, no noise, pool, there is always safe parking, walking dist to disney, drive to downtown disney and park for free so the walk is closer. I think Alpine has stroller rental. Free clean simple cont'l breakfast. Overall 10/10 from me.  U don't want to spend $90 somewhere to save a few dollars to risk not having the things i mentioned, do you? This is a little gem.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  You are correct that I have the most wonderful staff including Arosha, Jobbie, Rudy, Kevin, maintenance and housekeeping. It is our goal to make your Disney experience memorable and I am glad that you had a great time. With our convenient location to Disneyland, California Adventure and Downtown Disney, you can enjoy the easy walk and not worry about parking your car.  Our quiet, clean and comfortable room will ensure a restful night from a long day at Disney parks. With our affordable rate, your money will go a little further. Thank you for your review and I look forward to serving you in the near future.   Warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary: OUR 5 -night- stay at Alpine Inn is greatly satisfied. The room is clean, quiet. and they have free parking and internet！We will come back and recommend to friends！  服务热情， 位置极优， 设施齐全！对比周围的酒店是最佳选择！会推荐给朋友！
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for taking the time to leave us your review. I am so glad to learn that you had a wonderful 5 days with us. To better service our guests, we are upgrading our internet speed to be 10 times faster. When you visit us the next time, you will enjoy the free faster internet speed and free parking as well. We look forward to see you in the near future.  Warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary: rooms were good size, clean and comfortable. The location to Disneyland was fantastic as it was a short 10 min walk. I as able to leave the car after I had checked out so we could go to adventure park .
Manager Response: Dear guest,  We have many aussie guests stayed with us and welcome to our property. It is always a gamble to book a hotel in other parts of the world. I am glad that you found our property to be convenient, clean and competitive. Please don't wait too long to visit us again. Thank you.  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary Heading: Alpine Inn remains at the top of the heap
Summary: Good clean rooms, with a 10 minute walk to disneyland.  Plus breakfast.  Definitely worth it.  **When I was a child I had a fever.  My hands fealt just like two balloons.  Now I've got that feeling once again, cannot put my finger on it now, this is not how I am.**
Manager Response: Hello guest,  Thank you for your kind review. With comfortable and clean room, convenient location to Disneyland and affordable rate, we continue to improve upon our amenities and services to make your visit to the "Happiest Place on Earth" a memorable one for years to come.  Thank  you for staying with us and we look forward to serving you again in the near future.  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary: We've been staying at the Alpine Inn for the past 3 years now whenever we need to stay in Anaheim. It's right across the street from the Anaheim Convention Center and minutes away from Disneyland. We've even gone to Medieval Times and other local restaurants which are only about 20 minutes away. The staff is always accommodating and friendly and the rooms are well-equipped and comfortable. You cannot beat the Alpine Inn on value and location when staying in Anaheim.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for your wonderful review. It is our goal to make guests stay comfortable, memorable and affordable. We offer the best location, rate and services. I am so glad you had a great time. Please come and visit us again in the near future.  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary: Very clean, friendly staff, close to Disneyland.  The beds were comfortable and they had WIFI for my son.  This hotel had everything you need for a fun family trip to Disneyland.  Very nice hotel for the price and would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  You are correct about our friendly staffs. I am a lucky manager to work with great people. Our mission at Alpine Inn is to make sure all our guests will make memorable  experience when visit Anaheim Resort. I am glad that we have achieve this goal for you. Please remember to visit us in the near future. Thank you.  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary Heading: Loved that this inn was so close to Disneyland only a 10 min walk!
Summary: This Inn was very close to Disneyland!It was a 10 minute walk to the Disneyland entrance!We loved that the parking was free and very affordable!We are going to recommend Alpine Inn to family and friends!
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for your review. You are correct on our great location and rate. Alpine Inn is situated on the same campus as Disney Resort and directly across from Anaheim Convention Center. Our affordable rate includes free parking, free wifi, in-room microwave, mini frig, hair dryer, coffee maker, iron, ironing board, new LCD TV and premium cable channels. Everyone at Alpine Inn look forward to your next visit with us. Thank you.  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary: This hotel was a convenient place for us to stay.  My daughter was performing in cheerleading nationals at the convention center so it was convenient to be so close.  The only disappointing part was our coffee was not replenished after our first day there.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank  you for leaving us with  your valuable review. I first would like to apologize for the coffee not been replenished after the first day and had a discussion with housekeeping already to make sure this does not happen in the future. With our location directly across from the Anaheim Convention Center, you are correct on the convenience.  I truly hope that your will stay with us again and please do stop by and say hi to me. I will personally to make sure that everything is up to your satisfaction.   With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary: This is becoming our go-to place to stay whenever we go to Disneyland. It's affordable, clean, close to the parks, and provides such great service. Everyone is so friendly and helpful. Thank you Alpine Inn. We'll see you on our next trip.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for your wonderful review. You are right on our affordable rate, clean room,s convenient location to both Disney Parks and Anaheim Convention Center and great services. I can not say it better myself. Thank you and look forward to your next visit with us.  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary: Stayed here for four nights while visiting Disneyland. The rooms were clean and beds were always made upon our arrival. Front desk staff was always friendly and helpful. The rooms were quiet, you'd never know you were staying on a busy street and everything we needed was in walking distance. Would definitely stay again.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  It is wonderful that you had a great time at Disneyland during the day and restful nights at our property. Our goal is to provide our guests with clean rooms and beds, hospitable services, great rates and memorable experience at Disney Parks. I am glad that we have achieved our goal. Please come and visit us in the near future.  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary: Great place to stay with your family. It's clean and quiet. The one complaint that I did have is that they charged me more then what it originally specified on booking.com. Even with spending slightly more than advertised I still was very pleased with the hotel. We had friends stay across the street at the Hilton and they now have bed bugs. Alpine Inn is the best for the money period.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give us your honest review. I am glad that you find our room to be clean, quiet and the property is family friendly. On the issue of over charging, it could possibly be that the quote from booking.com does not have taxes calculated into the total. If it is not the case, please contact me at 800-772-442 directly and I will take care of the issue personally. Thank you again for staying with us and I look forward to serving you in the near future.  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary Heading: Disneyland trip was a whirl wind of fun!
Summary: Overall the alpine inn is awesome. It's been about four years since our last stay here, and it was great to see that the same service we had depended on in the past was still there. Our family now includes two small children, which means a stroller, and we did notice that with the stroller in the room, we were a little more crowed than before. The accommodations and location are great for the value. When we are on a budget, the alpine inn is a great place to stay.
Manager Response: Dear ;guest,  Thank you so much for staying with us again. You are right on that our services has not changed but there are some upgrades that we have made in the last four year. We changed all our linens and beddings, replaced new LCD TVs with premium channels, installed new carpeting, new shutters and added iron and ironing boards in all rooms. We are continue to search for new amenities and services to offer to our guest. I welcome to see us soon. Thank you.  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary: I chose to stay at the Alpine Inn for the last two nights because of it's proximity to Disney. I've been traveling around California for the last two weeks, staying mainly in travel lodges. This was by far the nicest place I stayed in.   The location - It's situated right behind the new cars attraction, so you can see the back of the facade. I'm a Disney geek so I thought this was pretty cool. To get to Disney you turn left, and walk around the corner and a few blocks down. It took me about 10 minutes - but I am a fast walker. There's a 7 Eleven and a few other shops along the way, which is useful if you'd like to stock up on snacks or essentials.  The room - The room was very clean and had a large modern TV with a great selection of channels. The beds were a good size and very
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for giving us your comment on your stay with us. It is really important for us to hear from our guests of their experience. You are absolutely correct on our location. We are situated right around the corner from Disney main entrance and direct across from the Anaheim Convention Center. All of our double rooms include two queen beds for comfort. Just recently, we have upgraded our cable to the premium package with HD channels. Last but not least, our staffs are always ready to serve our guests. We look forward to your  next stay with us in the near future. Thank you.  Best regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary: Our stay was wonderful. It was close enough to walk to the Disney resort. The staff was very welcoming and nice through our whole stay. The microwave and small refrigerator was awesome. We will definitely be staying here again.
Manager Response: Dear guest,    Thank you for taking the time to give us your experience at the Alpine Inn. You are right that I have wonderful staffs that work at this property from front desk, housekeeping to maintenance. I am extremely happy that we have exceeded your expectation. We are a no frill property with location within walking distance to both Disney parks and Anaheim Convention Center. With our competitive rate, you will certainly be able to saving some money for your other expenses and still have a great experience in visiting Anaheim. Everyone at Alpine Inn welcome you back in the near future.  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary: I want to write a new review about this hotel, that paints a different picture from the initial experience with the AI.  We had a terrible experience to begin with, a mix-up with scheduling when the front desk made the mistake and forgot to reschedule our date of stay.  We showed up, at 10:00pm, with sleeping kids, and there was no room for us, and had to search elsewhere.  The front desk person was unwilling to work with us.    So we left thinking to at the manager would be the same way.  We found another room at another hotel, but I had already been charged for this one.  I was upset.  I wrote a review of the hotel, and then wrote to the manager.  I had given up any hope of even hearing from the manager.  The very next day, I received a wonderful email from the manager of the
Manager Response: Dear Heather,  Thank you for this review and apologize for the trouble that  you went through. At Alpine Inn, we believe in taking care of our guests, appreciating their patronage and making their trip memorable.  We welcome you to come back and visit us again and I will personally take care of you.  Thank you.  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary Heading: Clean, close to everything you need
Summary: We stayed for 6 nights last week. I cant really fault the place, we were only there to sleep. Was very clean. Had all the basics you need. Staff were freindly and helpful. Pool looked clean but we were always back to late to give it a try. 15min walk to disneyland! Was perfect for us, we will be coming back here next time we visit Anaheim :)
Manager Response: Dear guest,  It is our goal to have all of our guests to have an fantastic Disney experience and create great memories for years to remember. I am glad to learn that you and your family had enjoyed your trip. We are a no frill hotel but offers clean and comfortable rooms at competitive rate. Please do visit us soon and we look forward to serving you again as our guest.  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary: Our family of six stayed there one night before waking up early to go to Disneyland.  We were pleased overall.  Couple things to note-  1.  Parking (free) is only for current guests so we had to move our car when we checked out in the morning. 2.  Cribs are $10 3.  The continental breakfast (free) technically starts at 7am but they set up early on the morning we were there
Manager Response: Dear guest,  I am glad to learn that you and your family had a restful night to get ready for the Disney excursion on the next day. We understand that cleanness, comfortable beds and quietness all very important for families on vacation and we have achieve our goal. Thank you for giving us your valuable review and we look forward to your next visit to Disney Resort.  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary Heading: Clean, comfortable and easy walk to the park...
Summary: We were on the ground floor and near the stairs, so there was a bit of noise from above, but for the price, I don't think you can do better. Free breakfast was OK (it was free). Check-in/out was fine. Parking was fine and also free. If you're on a budget and wanna be close to D-Land, stay here. We have stayed at several hotels near the park entrance and this was the best value of them all.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  I am very pleased to learn that you find our hotel to be clean, comfortable and competitive. With today's economy, we try to keep our rate fair and yet do not compromise on the amenities and services. With free parking, continental breakfast, WiFi and premium cable channels, we are continuing to look for new ways to service our guests better. Thank you and we look forward to serving your again in the near future.  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary Heading: Clean and Close to Convention Center
Summary: Room was nothing special, small but it was clean, had a nice TV. No desk to wok at, but free Internet. The Free breakfast was very basic. I drove a half mile down the street and had breakfast. Walk across the street to convention center and they let me leave my car at their lot after I checked out - it's the little things that make great for great service.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for your review. I am glad that you find our location directly across the street from the Anaheim Convention Center convenient. As for the work desk, we do have a desk in each room, a desk lamp and a chair. As our service, we try to accommodate parking after guests' check out if possible. Thank you again for taking the time and we look forward to serving you soon.  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary: Check-in and check-out was without problems.  You can also purchase tickets to Disneyland at the front office and avoid the long lines at the park.  The property sits on a major street, but the frontage building blocks most of the traffic sounds.  And you have to be outside the room to hear the screams coming from the Cars ride at the park.      The pool is advertised as heated, which is why I tried this location.  My son said it was Ok, but I noticed he did spend a lot of time in it, and this was February.  There was no jacuzzi.      The rooms were clean.  The carpet was also clean, which a lot of places in Anaheim and Buena Park don't have.  It was nice not to have to wear socks all the time.  TV had a decent selection of channels.  Room had a working microwave and mini
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give us a very detailed review. I am glad to know your son has enjoyed our outdoor heated pool in February; our front desk staffs made the check in, check out and the purchase of Disney tickets easy for you, our room was clean and comfortable after you and your family had a long day at Disneyland, our convenient location made your walk to Disneyland easy. We look forward to your next visit in the near future.  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary: Stayed a week following Thanksgiving. Made reservations last minute so had an upstairs. Friendly staff and when we unloaded our car, an employee offered to help us carry our stuff up the stairs. That was much appreciated even though we didn't take them up on their offer. Although the hotel is in the shadow of CA Adventure and a major street, it was rather quiet and felt secluded. Rooms were clean and comfortable and for the price, it is a very good deal. They changed their curtains to window shutters which is nice if you have allergies. We were too tired to go out to eat so thankfully there was a microwave so we could reheat food we had in our ice chest. 7-11 is within walking distance as well as subway and pizza. We have a large van so parking was difficult in their small lot
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for your review. When you are visiting the happiest place on earth, we would like to make your trip comfortable and memorable. The new carpet, window shutter and LCD TV are the latest addition to our rooms. Our staffs from front desk, maintainence to housekeeping are ready to serve the guests at all time. Please visit us again in the near future. Have a great 2014!  With warmest regards, Judy Pao

Summary Heading: A great value for the price
Summary: I recently stayed at Alpine Inn during a 5 day conference at the Anaheim Convention Center. The check in and check out process was easy and fast. Staff was very friendly. The room was clean and had great amenities such as a flat screen TV, free Wi-Fi, toiletries, microwave and fridge. The bathroom was of good size. The Inn is located right across the street from the Anaheim Convention Center and down the street from the entrance to Disney Land. You can hear the fireworks and some roller-coaster noise at times but it's over by 8pm. I'd stay there again.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  With location directly across fromt the convention center, you made a great choice to stay with us. We are small but offer personal services. With all the amanities, you are sure to have a restful night and wake up fresh to start another day at the conference. Thank you and have a great 2014!  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary: I was attending a convention and wanted something away from the busy hotels that were packed with delegates.  The Alpine is located across the street from the convention center and is a 5 minute walk.  It is also around 15 minute walk to Disney. The Alpine is your basic motel, and nothing fancy.  it is a super price and has free parking.  The breakfast is pretty basic, but has cereals, juices and hot  chocolate, oranges and apples and packaged  fancy muffins and pastry.  It was more than good enough, and I also took some with me for a snack.  Rooms are clean and showers are good.  Good WiFi. Friendly staff.  I was a bit disappointed in that they charged me .25 a page to print off my boarding pass and also charged a $2.00 commission to book the shuttle to the airport.  There is a
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for leaving us with your review and glad to learn that you will stay with us again at your next visit to Anaheim. We are trying our best to keep the rate affordable and offer amanities such as free parking, free wifi, microwave, refrigerator, LCD TV with premium cable channels, hair dryer, coffer maker, iron and ironing board. The printing charge is just to cover our cost. Please understand.   Have a happy New Year and a great 2014.  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary: Have stayed several places in Anaheim while visiting Disneyland but this is the most reasonable and convenient we have found. Room and bathroom were both clean and beds were comfortable. TV reception much better than the last place we stayed. We were visiting Knotts Berry Farm this trip but wanted something within walking distance of Bubba Gump's because we wanted dinner there. The Alpine Inn fit the bill and there was no charge for parking. Will definitely try to stay there again in the future.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  I am so happy that you had a great stay with us. I understand that with all the expenses during the holiday, we need to keep our rate reasonable for our guests to be able to get away from the hectic holiday schedule. I look forward to your next visit in the near future.  Happy New Year!  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary: So me and my wife stayed for two nights so we could spend a full day at Disney. The hotel was very clean and the staff was very kind. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was clean with lots of hot running water. Breakfast was good also. The advantage is that it is conveniently located; it took us only 10 to 15 minute to walk to Disney and also right around the corner is a convenient store. And yes, you get free parking. I would definitively recommend Alpine Inn.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for your kind review of this hotel. Front desk, housekeeping, maintenance and I try our best to provide the best service and comfort to all our guests after a long day at Disneyland Resort and continue our effort into the new year. We look forward to serving you as our guest the next time you visit Disneyland.  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary: We were looking for a clean room with an inexpensive rate within walking distance to Disneyland. That is what we got. It was about a 12 - 15 minute walk to Disneyland. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The second day there we noticed that the door to our room wasn't locking correctly. The staff was very accommodating. The breakfast is very limited. Just some muffins, granola bars, fruit, and cereal as well as coffee, orange juice, milk, tea, and hot chocolate. It was good to grab a little something to eat and head to the park though. The room was clean & updated for an older motel. We were pleased with it and would stay there again.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for staying with us on your last visit to Disneyland Resort. We offer great rates to our guests but do not compromise on the services, comfort and cleaness of the rooms. Another added value is our great location. All of us at Alpine Inn would like to wish you a great holiday and 2014. We look forwarding to you next visit with us.  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary: My husband, son and I wanted to get away from Nevada for the Thanksgiving weekend. We picked southern CA. One day at Disney, one day at Seal Beach. I've stayed at Alpine Inn before and was pleased to get the room at a reasonable rate. Clean room, good service, hope to go back soon.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for visiting us again during Thanksgiving weekend. As you have probably noticed that we have new LCD TV, carpeting and art works in all the rooms.  However, we have kept the great service and rate for our guests. I would like to wish your and your family a great holiday and 2014. I look forward to you next visit in the near future.  Warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary Heading: Perfect for what we needed it for
Summary: This is a simple, inexpensive, clean motel close to Disney. Breakfast includes cereal, juice, coffee, fruit, cereal bars and packaged pastries - nothing fancy (no protein) but easy to grab and walk to the parks. Would def recommend and would stay again.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  As an active Tripadvisor reviewer,  I would like to thank you for your honest and wonderful review. We are a no frill property but offers free continental breakfast, free parking and free wifi. Also our rooms are equipped amenties such as brand new LCD TV, mini frig, microwave, coffee maker, hair dryer, iron and ironing board. Please come visit us soon and have a great holiday!  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary: It was great, nice clean hotel walking distance to disney!!!But i just wish they had better stuff for breakfast!!! Service pretty good, nice people and good rooms to rest!! Nice place to find good food at night !!!!!!!!!
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for your review. We are closely located to Disneyland and many dining options in the areas. Like we always say, location, location and locataion. Please come back and visit us again in the near future.  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary: This is very good hotel-clean, not very expensive, it has good location near Disneyland, you also can buy tickets there.Friendly stuff,also they have a breakfast on the reception ,I can recommend thus hotel
Manager Response: Dear guest,  It is my goal to offer nice clean rooms and affordable price for all of our guests  for a good night rest after a fun day at Disnesyland. I am glad that we have achieved for you and your family. We will continue our effort to welcome you back on your next trip to Disneyland. Thank you and have a great holiday!  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary Heading: A Deal Awaits Right in Carsland Backyard
Summary: Tidy refurbished motel with a retro vibe. Rooms have all new furniture and carpeting. Bathrooms are clean but have not been renovated like the rest of the room.  Fantastic location and nice spread at breakfast. We just love the snow that never melts on the rooftop! Our new favorite Disneyland pad.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for your kind review. I had a child walked up to me one morning and asked if it snowed the night before. "Of course", I replied. I am glad that the everlasting snow is making an impression on you. We will continue to update our rooms and offer the best price, service and amenities to our guests. I wish to see you soon.  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary: We stayed here 4 nights to visit Disneyland. Let's starts with the positive aspects. 1.) Free parking  2.) clean room with two queen beds 3.) nice staff 4.) good price 5.) clean pool (though we didn't use it) 6.) mostly quiet, didn't hear much from any other rooms, though on our last night we could hear people walking around above us, but not enough to bother. 7.) good water pressure in shower. 8.) free wifi and reliable connection. Made watching Netflix after the little one went to bed very nice! 9.) being able to park right in front of our room!!  Now for the not so positive: 1.) very small parking area. If you don't need to move your vehicle during your stay - don't! 2.) The beds are not really walk around. One side of both beds is right by the wall. We pushed our bed a
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for your review. It is difficult to enlarge the rooms that is the reason we install the wood shutter instead of drapery. We try to put the two beds together closer in the middle thus give a bigger walkway on the other side of the beds. With the new LCD TVs, the rooms felt more spacious. I am glad that you found all the positives about our property and I wish to serve you again in the near future.  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary: Our family stayed here for our trip to Disneyland...great service, quiet spot, nice rooms with comfortable beds.  Nice heated pool and terrific location (15 minute kid-walk to Disneyland).  Definitely recommended.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  With location right behind California Adventure Park, you can certainly feel the closeness and excitment. Yet it is very quiet at night for all our quests to have a restful sleep. I am happy to learn that you find our property to be adquate to all your needs. Please do come visit again in the near future. Thank you.  With warmest regards, Judy Pao

Summary: We have visited many hotels around Disneyland and have been pleasantly surprised by Alpine Inn. The walk to Disneyland isn't very far. The staff is always friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean (except for the carpet but good luck finding one that has clean carpet around Disneyland). Stayed here twice so far and plan on coming back. There's a 7-11 on the corner which is really convenient. There's an Alamo rental car right next door. Hotel is backed up to California Adventures Cars Land which is a plus in our books. Our kiddo is 2 and loved seeing the Radiator Springs mountain range from the hotel room. You can hear screaming from the rides but it's not very loud and fun if you're down there for Disneyland anyways, makes you feel like you're close to the action.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for your review. I just want to let you know that we have replaced carpeting in all of our room as of last Wednesday. When you visit us the next time, you should feel comfortable for your two year old to walk in our room. I appreciate your comment on our clean room, good service and the locaiton. Please come and visit us again soon. Wish you and your family a great holiday!  With warmest regars, Judy Pao

Summary Heading: Good value in walking distance to parks.
Summary: The alpine inn was about a 10 minute walk to Disneyland-not bad at all. The rooms are a bit small but they were clean. They offered free parking which not all hotels around the parks do and they also have free wifi. Their free breakfast consists of two kinds of cereal, granola bars and packaged donuts/pastries. Some would complain about this but we found that it was perfect to be able to grab the packaged items to take into the park with us. We are definitely going to stay here again based on our first experience with them!
Manager Response: Dear guest,  I am so happy that your first stay with us is pleasant. We understand that everyone needs a break from the everyday life. With today's economic, we are determined to offer the best amenities that the guests can enjoy on their visits to the Happiest Place on Earth. I look forward to your next visit.  With warmest regars, Judy Pao

Summary: Good staff, clean, large rooms, close to the convention centre and lots of nearby shopping and dining. The AC was a little loud but over all it was a great stay.  There is an outdoor pool which got good use but I did use it myself.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Location, location and location; you are absolute correct on our great locations. We are directly across from the Anaheim Convention Center and right behind the California Adventure Park. Because we are a small property thus allow us to give a more personal service. We wish to your home away from home. Thank you for staying and I look forward to serving you soon.  With warmest regards, Judy Pao

Summary Heading: Very affordable, clean, and close to Disneyland.
Summary: This was our third stay and we have no complaints. This time around we stayed on the first floor and we were able to park right in front of our room. The room is updated and very modern and it it's very clean. We will definitely come back!
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for choosing us again for your last visit to Disneyland. This year we have installed new carpeting in all the rooms, replaced all TVs to LCD flat screens and added some colors to the rooms with the new paintng on the wall. I look forward to your next visit with us in the near future. Have a great holiday!  With warmest regards, Judy Pao

Summary Heading: Clean room, close to Disney, but they nickel & dime you .....
Summary: The rooms were clean and comfortable.  It is close to the Disneyland entrance, about a 10-15 minute walk.  Several eating options on the walk to Disney.  The cons were not deal breakers but did irritate me from the customer service stand point.  Check in is 2:00 or 3:00pm which is industry norm; however, usually if the hotel has a room available they will let you check in early at no charge.  Alpine charged me $35 to check in early.  I've never experienced being charged if they room is available.  I could understand if I had asked them to clean a room quickly so I could check in but that wasn't the case.  The hotel also charges for ice - again I've never seen a hotel do this either.  The other con could be a pro depending on your outlook.  Since the hotel is adjacent to the
Manager Response: Dear guest,  I did a little digging and found your reservation. According to our system, you checked in at 9:21 in the morning. That is the $35.00 early check-in charge. Our normal check in is at 2PM and always try our best to accommodate all guests. Please call me at 714-535-2186 directly when you book with us next time. I will personally take care of you. Thank you for your valuable comment and I look forward to your next visit with us.  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary Heading: Great value and close to Disney
Summary: I have stayed at many nice hotels in my past travels and this one was decent. It's a no frills motel that is clean, convenient, and comfortable. The value can't be beat with free wifi, free parking, and free continental breakfast. It backs right up to California Adventure and is within very comfortable walking distance to Disney. The rooms had newer contemporary style furniture with flat screen tv's. I thought the size if the room was pretty standard. There was also a small microwave and fridge which was nice to have. Overall the rooms were very clean and housekeeping came everyday and refreshed our room. The motel itself was not bad in terms of noise level. You will hear the evening festivities of Disneyland but that's what happens when you are so close! Parking was not a
Manager Response: Dear guest,  You are right on that we are a no frill motel. However, we try to provide the best amenities, service and price for our guests. With all the money our guests spend at Disneyland, we try our best to offer reasonable rate to stay with us while enjoying all the fun at Disney Resort. Thank you for staying and your kind words to your friends and family. We hope to see you soon.  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary: We stayed at the Alpine Inn for 4 nights on our trip to Disneyland and California adventure. The walk was a little more than I thought and may have been a little too much for our 4 year old but I enjoyed it. The room was very clean and housekeeping did a great job keeping up with it. The beds were so cozy! We didn't use the pool because I forgot our swimsuits and we probably wouldn't have had time anyway but we went to dip our feet in and it was nice and warm. Breakfast selection was minimal but definitely convenient to have a little snack before heading to the parks. We added another night and they were very accomodating. I'd definitely recommend Alpine Inn to friends/family and if we ever go back to disneyland I would most definitely stay there again!
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for leaving us with your feedback of the stay. We understand that after a long day at Disneyland, you need to have a good rest on a comfortable bed. We were very careful in selecting the mattresses for our guests. Our pool is set at comfortable 85F for our guests to take a dip year around. Please do remember to bring your bathingsuit to enjoy on your next visit with us. See you soon.  with warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary: We spent 4 nights at the Alpine Inn last week. It was affordable, clean and a close walk to Disneyland. All the staff were very friendly. The continental breakfast was nice, easy to grab and eat on the walk to the parks. Would recommend the Alpine Inn to anyone looking for a great price and great location. We will stay again on our next trip.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  It is so wonderful to learned that you had a great stay and will come back to visit us on your next trip to Disneyland. We strive to make your vacation memorable and glad that we have achieved our goal. Thank you and see your soon.  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary: We have stayed here for the past 15 years for our trips to Disneyland and have seen it change considerably.  The rooms are clean and quiet.  There is a pool that I have not ever taken advantage of but they do keep it clean.  The breakfast items they have in the lobby each day are of a wide variety and there is something for everyone.  During our recent stay, the internet connection in the room wasn't working properly but it was in the process of being fixed.  There was a computer available in the lobby.  I would recommend this for anyone looking to stay close to Disneyland.  Additionally, they don't charge for parking, which is another plus.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Wow, you have been our guest for 15 years. It is such a privilege to earn your loyalty. Now we need to work even harder to keep you coming back. Please stop in the next time you visit us. I would like to personally thank you.  With warmest regard, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary: Wonderful staff, very helpful, efficient and friendly. Clean well maintained rooms with microwave and mini refrigerator.  Very Comfortable. Close walking distance to Disneyland, the Convention Center, and Garden Walk (great restaurants). Pool small but clean with seating. Easy access off Katella. Free continental breakfast available every morning, a definite plus for quick start mornings. I would definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Every time that we received a positive review, it just made our day. But more importantly, we knew that you had a wonderful vacation. Our wish is to make everyone's vacation memorable. In your case, we have done our job. Thank you and we look forward to serving you again in the near future.  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary Heading: Clark Griswold esq, with a view of the bigger resorts.
Summary: I should have known what I'd gotten myself into. The motel is situated off of the busy road, next to a rent a car lot, and under the power lines for the park. As you pull into the "court yard" you see what appears to be a pool, although it looks like it haven't been used in a decade. Apparently we "booked two rooms" therefore, we had to pay a $70 cancelation fee. After my wife and kids gave me the tounge lashing I deserved, we walked our gear up three flights of stairs to our miniature room. The room was very clean, a little noisy, but well kept and clean. The maid service did a great job throughout our stay. The motel is located about 20min (walking) from the park entrance. You also walk through what I will now call "Anaslime." Don't go the "cheap" route when booking a trip to
Manager Response: Dear guest,  I learned from my front desk manager that you had made 2 bookings through the internet and you only intended to book for 1 room. Our cancellation policy is 48 hours prior to arrival, my staff only followed the rule of this property. However, my staff offered you free crib for 4 nights at the value $40 and offered early check in at noon instead of 2PM. I am glad that you find our room to be clean and comfortable. Thank you for bringing this to my attention and I appreciate you business.  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary Heading: Clean comfortable and close to Disneyland
Summary: Very budget friendly motel close to Disneyland theme parks. Nice quiet location and room had everything we needed at cost effective price. Staff also very helpful and friendly. I would definitely stay here again if visiting Anaheim.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for taking the time to leave us the review. Everyone at Alpine Inn are putting in 100% to make sure our guests have a nice comfortable stay after a long day at Disneyland. I am glad we were able to satify  your need. I look forward to seeing you in the next visit to Disney Resort.  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary: This inn is in a walkable distance to the most tourist attractions, e.g. Disneyland, Golden Walk, etc. The room is clean and comfortable. I was staying on the first floor and it was not noisy. The staffs are helpful and friendly.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  I am so happy to learn that you had a good stay with us. We are conveniently located and within walking distance to Disney Resort. With our clean room and comfortable beds, you will be ready to start another day of fun at Disneyland. Thank you and I look forwrd to your next stay with us.  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary: The pirce was great and a walking distance from Diseny Land ! we parked the car in the parking and walked to DL! I would highly recommend this place for anyone spending vacation in California Totally perfect for our Disneyland trip! Beds are VERY comfortable
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for leaving a kind review. We are a no frill property with great location, nice clean rooms, comfortable beds and affordable price. It is a thrill for all of us to see a positive review like yours. We are now more motivated and ready to give our 110%. Thank you again.  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary Heading: Nice and affordable property near Disneyland
Summary: This is not a 5star hotel but an average property which is clean and affordable near Disneyland. I stayed here with a family of 4 and we found this place reasonable. If you are looking for a property with luxury then ofcourse this is not for you but if you are looking for a good decent place to stay while on your trip to Disney or LA, then you can definitely stay here..... The room was clean and the bed comfortable to sleep... There were some good Indian restaurants also nearby so overall a good stay in a reasonable budget. Internet works fine... and ofcourse there is breakast also included in the stay.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  As the manager of the property, it is alawys pleasing to receive a positive review. We strive to provide excellent service to our guests at an afforadable price. Thank you for letting us know your stay and please visit us again in the near future.  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary: The room was clean and bed was comfortable. They provided simple breakfast like muffins, buns and orange juice which I normally grab for my gal to eat as we walk to disneyland. Its a 15 to 20 min walk from the hotel. There's a 7-11 and ABC store nearby, so very convenient if you need to get anything. There's also some fastfood stores like subway across the street. I'm happy with our stay.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for your review. Our location, price and amanities sure make us one of the top choiced for travelers visiting Anaheim. We are continue to search for new ways to serve our guests better. Thank you and look forward to serving you again in the near future.  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary: Totally perfect for our Disneyland trip! Beds are VERY comfortable. Best night sleep I have had in a hotel in a long time! Very quiet, pool was great for a mid day Disneyland break. Breakfast included...FREE parking...What more can you ask for? We will be BACK!
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for your VERY wonderful review. I am so glad you had a great night of sleep after a long day at Disneyland and you were able to enjoy our pool. We are looking forward to see you in the near future.  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary Heading: Disneyland Half Marathon Weekend - Great Value!
Summary: We needed a hotel close to Disneyland so we could participate in the 1/2 marathon weekend.  You cannot beat the price and location of this hotel.  The rooms were very clean and not any smaller than any other standard hotel room.  The hotel is across the street from the convention center and about a 20-25 minute walk (slow pace) from the 10k/half marathon start line, Downtown Disney, Disneyland California Adventure entrance.  The hotel offered fruit and a basic continental breakfast, which was a nice surprise.  The rooms also have a small fridge and microwave so we could store/heat up food we purchased. The salt water pool was also a nice touch when we wanted to soak up the sun. We were very pleased with the Alpine Inn and would stay here again if we were to come back to
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for staying with us during the Disney Half Marathon and happy to know that we made your stay comfortable. All of our staffs are trained to provide the best service to our guests. Hope to see you soon. Thank you again.  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary: We had a great stay. We rented a two room with 3 queen beds which worked out great for the family. The room was nice and clean and with the second bedroom, made it nice and spacious. It was a great size and very good value. We were very happy with our stay and will be going again this month. Already made the reservation to use our last day out of our pass to Disneyland. The walk is very close and easy.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  I am so happy that we had provided the service, location and rate during Disney Half Marathon. And extremely pleased to learn that you will visit again this month, Thank you for your kind words and we will always be here to make your visit to Anaheim memorable.   With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine inn

Summary Heading: Alpine Inn is a great value for Disneyland
Summary: We wanted a 2-night stay within easy walking distance of the Disney Resort theme parks at reasonable cost (about $100/night total).  The Alpine Inn is by far the best value we found.  Other options at similar cost had double beds (2 queens at Alpine Inn), charged bogus "resort fees" and might charge extra for more than 2 adults (we had 3 adults and 1 child, cost is the same for 1 room up to 4 adults).  Beds were on the firm side, free breakfast was minimal but sufficient.  Kudos for free parking for a second car and for parking during the day after checkout (website says $10 for parking a second car).  Clean, attractive rooms, nice towels and climate control.  10-15 minute stroll to park entrances, perfect for families on a budget.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for leaving your review. We are within walking distant to Disneyland Resort, offering affordable rates, free parking, comfortable beds and personal service to all our guests. I look forward to serving you again as our guest in the near future. Thank you again.  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary Heading: Princess wives may use their veto, but still a good place to stay.
Summary: First let me state that if your wife is a Princess then this may not be the place for you.  But as far as value hotels go, you can't do much better than the Alpine Inn.  My wife prefers higher-end hotels but I won the debate this time because when at Disney how much time do you really spend in your hotel?  I kept track to prove a point; not including the time spent after the lights are out and you are sleeping, we spent an average of 3.5 hours/day in the room.  Which is good because on the negative side of this motel is that the rooms are very small with 2 double beds crammed into the space and not a lot of room to lay your luggage out.  We were travelling with 2 teens so space was an issue.  When sitting at the desk working on the laptop, there wasn't much space to get around
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for staying with us. Been an older property, I admit that our rooms are a bit small. However, we do offer clean rooms with amenities like micro, mini frig, free WiFi and just around the corner from Disneyland. I am so lucky to have the best staffs working for me in the office and in the rooms. Thank you again for staying and look forward to seeing you soon.  With warmest regars, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights while visiting Disneyland. We loved it. The staff was very friendly, the rooms were clean, and the pool was nice on a hot summer day. We appreciated the 20 minute walk to the park entrance, but some may see this as a minus. Nothing luxurious, but a really great value!
Manager Response: Dear guest,  I am so glad to know that you had a great stay with us. You are right that our rooms are basic however we offer brand LCD TVs, new carpeting, microwave, mini frig, premium cable with HBO, free parking, free WiFi and a complementary breakfast. In additional, there is a outdoor heated pool that is open year round.   Thank you again for your review and we look forward to serving you again in the near future.   With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary Heading: not bad , will stay here again if going to Disneyland.
Summary: location is great , about 20 mins walk from motel to Disney land entrance , (we have a 8 yr old girl ).  included breakfast were prepackaged muffin , pastry , cereal , juice and coffee , may not be the best but we ate a muffin , drink milk or coffee, then grab a few energy bar and just get going to the park , it is all good , by 10 am we eat the energy bar to fill in the gap before lunch .  you can hear the fireworks every night , also can 'see ' it at the hilton glass wall reflection.  room is old but relatively clean , shower had good hot water and pressure , however I did find someone's hair on one of the beds first thing I walked and did my usual check ...I carefully clean the bed and didn't really bother me, I mean right all this is a motel with a great price , can't expect
Manager Response: Dear guest,  I had several guests told me about watching the fireworks at the Hilton glass reflection and glad that you had enjoyed it.   Everyone also says that location, location and location is important. We certainly offer a great location to visit Disneyland or Anaheim Convention Center.   However, the hair on the bed is unacceptable for my standard. I have spoke to my housekeeping staffs and make sure that they pay special attention to this matter. Thank you for letting me know. I look forward to serving you again.  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary Heading: Older Motel, but good value for your dollar.
Summary: Try this on with a quick turnaround trip.  Booked it the morning we left.  Check in was easy, room was clean.  Parking was right in front of room.  Older motel, but clean and staff was friendly.  Saw lots of other families staying at the property.  I experienced no issues with my stay.  Will definitely stay here on future trips.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  I must admit that we are older and smaller and yet we offer nice clean rooms, comforatble beds, convenient location and friendly services. It is great to know that we were able to satify your needs on a last minute trip. Please come visit us again on your next trip to the area. Thank you.  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary: This is a smaller, older property.  But it is well maintained! We arrived super early the day of check in (about 9:30am).  The gentleman working the reception desk was nice and let us park (giving us a parking pass).  It was nice to park and go see some sites.  All the staff was super nice! The hotel is about a 10-15 minute walk from the hotel to the gates of Disneyland.  (which is not bad!)  You do not have to cross any major streets, you basically walk down Katella and turn at Harbor, walk up Harbor until you turn towards Disneyland.  It is literally right behind the Radiator Springs Racers in DCA.  It is across the street from the convention center. The room was adequate.  Not big, but it suited our needs.  It was clean, and the beds were comfy.  The housekeeping staff is
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for leaving a wonderful review. We understand that our guests are visiting the Happiest Place on Earth and we must offer the best service to make the trip memorable. As a small property in the area, we are able to offer more personal services than big box hotels in the area. I am so glad that you were able to take advantage the early check in and the outdoor heated pool. We look forward to serving you in the near future.  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary Heading: We look forward to staying there again...
Summary: We were so busy that we didn't get to spend much time at the hotel. That said, it's no wonder we weren't there much, as the location was perfect for attending activities at the Anaheim Convention Center and a visit to Disneyland. The staff people were friendly and helpful, the room was clean and not musty, and we were able to pack lighter and re-wear outfits due to the on-premises laundry room. We also appreciated having a refrigerator and microwave in the room. On the last day, we finally made use of the pool and were pleased to find that the water was very clean and kept at a comfortable temperature. A great way to end our visit to California before starting on the long train trip home.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  I am so happy that you find our location, the onsite laundry, microwave, mini frig and the pool had all contributed to a memorable stay for you. We are a small property and yet offer amenities just like our neighboring large properties. The best thing is that you have saved on your lodging expenses. Please do come back and visit us again. Thank you.  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary: I chose the Alpine Inn for its location, right across from the Anaheim Convention Center, where I was attending the D23 Expo.  Very convenient, and much less expensive than the "convention center" big hotels. The room was clean, bed very comfortable, AC was nice and cold although somewhat noisy (but didn't bother me in the least, I like "white noise"), strong and fast WIFI, nice TV.  I liked being able to park in front of my room (stayed on ground floor).  Front desk staff very friendly and accommodating.  Having the little fridge and microwave was great.  I grabbed a couple of granola bars each morning as I brought my own breakfast food, and had them for snacks later in the day. Didn't use pool as I was busy all day.  Although I didn't go to Disneyland while staying there, I
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for taking the time to leave us your experience during D23 Expo. You are absolutely right about our convenient location; directly across from  the Anaheim Convention Center and around the corner from the Disneyland main entrance. I am glad that you had a great stay and look forward to serving you on your next visit to the Anaheim resort.  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary: Very friendly hotel staff, clean large room.  Close to Disneyland and the convention center for the D23 convention. I really enjoyed my stay and look forward to coming back to go to Disneyland in October.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for staying with us during D23. You are absolute correct on our convenient location. With Anaheim Convention Center locates across the street and Disneyland just around the corner, our guests can simply walk to both. Thank you again for staying and look forward to serving you again.  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary: We chose the Alpine Inn based on the great reviews here on tripadvisor, a great rate and their location, right across the street from the Anaheim Convention Center, where we attended the Disney D23 Expo, Aug 8-11. And what a great choice! We had a nice clean comfortable room. Everyone from the front desk to the cleaning staff were very nice and friendly. The hotel also has a nice little spread they put out for breakfast with coffee, pastry, cereal and fresh fruit.  Since we recently purchased Annual Passes to Disneyland Resort, we'll definitely be frequent guests at the Alpine Inn. Thank you so much for a great experience. We loved our stay.  To get to Downtown Disney and the park entrances, we took the shortcut through the Grand Californian hotel near the Alpine Inn.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Been a hotelier for the past 8 years, a review like yours really motivate us to best service our guests for either business at the Anaheim Convention Center or pleasure to visit Disneyland. With location across from the convention center and around the corner from Disneyland, we offer the best location. I am so happy to learn that you are an annual passport holder, that means we will see more of your smiling face. We look forwad to serving you again in the near future.   With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary Heading: Perfect for the Happiest Place on Earth!
Summary: We stayed 5 nights.  It really was walking distance to main gate of DLand/Calif Adventure.  Took us 13 minutes - .6 miles.  MUCH better to walk than drive or take the ART.  You didn't have to cross any major roads - so no intersection signals to wait for.  Easy and safe. Was only a 15 minute walk the other direction down Katella and into Downtown Disney (cut through the Grand Californian Hotel).  A 7-11 was 1 building away.  Great for the cheap deli foods.  The pool was smaller, but we were the only ones in it.  Loved that our room was on the lower level and we could park in front of the door.  Easy access.  The carpet was very dirty - I did notice my family's dirty feet bottoms as they laid on the beds :-( The beds were VERY comfortable. The breakfast was only pre-packaged
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for your review. To be situated on the Disneyland Resort campus, you are absolute right on the easy walk to Disneyland without crossing any major streets. On the issue of dirty carpet, we installed new carpets in our rooms at the beginning of June. If there are any requests that we can help to make your stay better, please let us know. We understand that you are visiting the happiest place on earth and certainly want you to have a great night of sleep at the of the day. Thank you again for the time to give us your valuable review and we look forward to your next visit.   With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary: Alpine Inn had the best rate for the time of stay (August 4-6). I am glad it was on the same side of the street as Disney. Although the parking lot looked small, all cars fit and you were able to leave with no problems. Room was located on second floor. Clean room with a nice flat screen tv. It was enough for myself & traveling Disney brother. I took advantage of the continental breakfast on Tuesday morning before our half day at the park. Although the walk seemed farther, it was always great to see the snow covered log cabin after we closed the park. Yes I would recommended Alpine Inn for another stay.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  I am so glad that you have tried us out last time and found a pleasure to stay with us. We are aware the difficulty of the current economics situation with everyone and have offered affordable rate. Yet we kept our ameninities such as new LCD flat screen TV, microwave, mini frig, free WiFi, iron, ironing boards and coffee maker for the convenience of all guests. Please remember to visit us on your visit to Disneyland Resort and until then please enjoy the rest of your summer.  With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary: We picked this motel at the last minute for a quick visit to Disneyland.  The location is not the best, as I prefer Harbor locations, but it fit the bill.  The room was clean and new looking.  Flat screen TV and very comfortable beds.  The night desk person checked us in with a smile and helped in any way he could.  The morning  desk person, Rudy, was just as friendly and made our stay enjoyable.  The wifi was great and the whole area was very quiet.  I would consider returning as we have APs,but the location is a bit far for the walk a couple times a day.  If the south gate to Disneyland opened on a regular basis, this place would be a winner!
Manager Response: Dear guest,  I am so glad to learn that you have enjoyed your stay with us. As an annual pass holder, you must have stayed in many places before. To be one of your top choice for your next trip, we are honored. I am very lucky to have great staffs working at the property. Everyone at Alpine Inn is ready to serve our guests.   In regards to the souther entrance of Disneyland Resort which is 50 yards from our front door, Disney has yet made a decision to open the gate. As soon as we know the decision, we will let you know. Thank you for choosing us.   With warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary: When looking for a place for me to stay during a conference at the convention center, my manager was delighted to find this relatively inexpensive hotel so close. You literally cannot get any closer without staying at the Hilton, which is on the convention center premises. The room was clean and the beds were among the more comfortable ones I've slept on, and they provide plenty of pillows. My only complaint is that the wifi is terrible--only working about half the time, and patchy even then. This is probably not an issue for families visiting Disneyland (which is a half-mile walk away) but it caused problems for me. Fortunately the convention center's wifi was decent, as was the nearby iHop (where I sit writing this review right now). A side benefit is the hotel's kitschy
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for taking the time to leave us your experience at the Alpine Inn. I am so happy that you enjoyed the stay except for the WiFi. With smart phones, ipads and other smart devices, we have recently noticed the slow speed and unstable connectivity to our WiFi. I am in the process of working with cable company and our IT person to come up with a better solution. This should all be resolved in the next couple of weeks. Please do come and visit again to a better WiFi environment.  Warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary: We stayed at the Alpine Inn for 6 nights in Mid July.  My first concern with hotel rooms, is it  clean and safe?  This was both.  The rooms are not huge, there were 4 (2 adults and 2 kids) of us, but they were adequate.    The beds were excellent.  Nice and firm.  Pillows were great too.  While we were there, they upgraded to a brand new flat screen TV in the room.  The kids enjoyed the heated pool. No frills, just a clean safe hotel room that is within walking distance Disneyland.  Also, very close to Anaheim Resort Transit bus stops.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  I am so glad to hear that you enjoyed the new LCD TV during your stay. You are correct that we are a no frill hotel but offer microwave, mini frig, free parking, free wifi, new carpeting, TV, comfortable beds, outdoor heated pool and a affordable price. Thank you for your review and hope to serve you as our guest soon.   Warmest regards, Judy Pao Manager of Alpine Inn

Summary: For me, cleanliness greatly impacts my experience. My family and I drove a long way for a trip to Disneyland. Arriving late in the night, we planned to get a good night's sleep, for an early morning start. We were all excited to see how remarkably  close Alpine Inn is to Disneyland. Unfortunately, my excitement quickly dissipated upon pulling back the top sheet of the bed to find some ambiguous splatter substance stained on the fitted sheet. Pulling the top sheet back more, to replace the soiled fitted sheet with a clean one from the office, I found hair in the bed.  I tried to move pass the dirty bed, and not let it get to me, but each place I moved to greeted me with more hair, all different colors and textures, from appearance. Hair in the refrigerator, hair in the ice
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for your honest review and would like to apologize to you for this experience. I have since called a staff meeting with all of my housekeeping personnels. To start with laundry staffs, the new procedure is to examine the sheets and towel to make sure it is clean and in nice conditions. Secondly, the cleaning staffs will pay attention to make sure the sheets and towels are clean and hair free in all rooms. Thus, we can prevent this from happening again. If I may, I would like to invite you back to visit us again to a nice and clean room. Should you decide to do so, please call me personally. Thank you.  Warmest regards, Judy Pao for Alpine Inn

Summary Heading: Walk to Disney, Comfy Pretty Room!
Summary: Close enough to push our daughter to Disneyland in a stroller and walk home tired that night! Very clean, older on the outside but definitely remodeled inside. So quaint and cute. You can hear the fireworks at night! Not enough to wake you up though ;)
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for taking the time to leave your kind review. With location right behind the California Adventure Park, our guests can walk into the Disneyland parks. When you visit us the next time, you will see the new carpeting and 37" brand new LCD color TV in all of our rooms. Please do come visit us again. Thank you again.  Warmest regards, Judy Pao Manager of Alpine Inn

Summary: Rooms are your basic hotel rooms, nothing fancy--if you're looking for luxury, this is not for you; if you're looking for a good place to stay near Disneyland at a great price, than this is for you. Beds and bedding are clean and very comfy, lots of pillows! Carpets are a bit dirty, but we wore our flip-flops and it was no big deal. There is a mini-fridge & microwave in the room, which was very convenient for preparing our own meals. They offer packaged muffins, doughnuts, etc. for breakfast and some beverages (hot/cold). We always went to Denny's on our way to Disneyland for a full breakfast. Parking is free, a plus for us since we had a rental. The pool is small, but clean and nice for taking a dip. The staff was very helpful, printed our tickets for Disney & San Diego Zoo and
Manager Response: Dear guest,  I would  like to thank you for your kind review. Our goal is to provide clean and comfortable rooms with amenities such as microwave, mini frig, in room coffee make, iron, ironing board, color LCD TV with premium cable, free wifi and parking.   On the issue of carpeting, we have installed new carpet in over 60% of our rooms and will complete by the end of summer. Even without flip flop, you can walk comfortablely.   You are correct that we are located directly next to the Disneyland south entrance. We are talking to them and hope that the gate will be permantely open for the convenience of our guests. Since it is the decision of Disney, we will continue to negotiate.  Again, thank you and look forward to serving you again.  Best regards, Judy Pao Manager of Alpine Inn

Summary: We realized that this Is a modest hotel so didn't expect too much, but can't recommend it. Unless you can sleep with light pouring in through shutters (no blackout curtains, so light came through the slats). Also had filthy carpet, which mgr at first offered to have cleaned but later in the day said it couldn't be done and instead offered to move us. Traveling with a child and already being settled into the room for 1.5 days made us say no to the move, because there was no guarantee that the light wouldn't still pour into another room. Front desk was nice, except mgr, who was not sympathetic and refused to lower the room rate (of $110/night with military discount) or compensate in any way.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  I am so sorry that your stay with us was unpleasant. We recently installed the wood shutter to update our rooms for a modern look and was assured that it would block outside light. I will search for a solution to resolve this.   In regard to carpeting, we have installed new carpeti  in all of the downstairs rooms and will install the upstairs rooms after summer. To ensure the cleaniness of the carpet, we are washing the parkinging twice a week.  In couple of weeks, we will have brand new LCD flatscreen TVs in all rooms. I sincerely would like to invice you back and give us another chance. Please call me directly and I will assist you with reservation.   Thank you for your honst review and we will do our best to remedy the issues.  Warmest regards, Judy Pao Manager of Alpine Inn.

Summary: Rooms were clean. Short walk to Disneyland. The room was right behind California Adventures. The noise was very minimal in the room. We will definitely stay again the next time we go. Best value we could find by a long shot.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for your kind review, I am happy to learn that you had a good stay with us while visiting Disneyland. Please do remember to visit us during your next stay.  WArmest regards, Judy Pao Manager of Alpine Inn

Summary: We booked this hotel back in early Feb for our June vacation due to proximity, price and decent reviews. About a week prior to our stay I noticed the rates had dropped just over $20 per night from the reserved rates, and with a four night stay, that would have been significant savings. I contacted them twice to find out if they honored price drops. I was never contacted back, even just to be told no. I was beginning to have my doubts even before checking in. I'm disappointed in the lack of customer service, and that was the ultimate selling point in our decision to switch hotels just before check in when we were able to secure the same rate at a closer and comparable hotel. I wish I 'd had the opportunity to provide a real review of the stay I was so looking forward to for the
Manager Response: Dear guest,  I would like to apologize to you for the experience and disappointment with my staffs for their way of heandling  this matter. At Alpine Inn, we strive to provide the best customer service and have certainly failed in your case.   I would like to invite you back to visit us the next time your visit Disneyland. Please call me personally and I will do my best to make your visit memorable.  Warmest regards, Judy Pao Manager of Alpine Inn

Summary: We stayed at Alpine Inn for two nights mid week before Memorial Day Weekend.   I found a great deal online website for $80 per night.   We had two adjoining rooms on the ground floor.   We didn't use the pool, but did eat the breakfast.   Breakfast is very simple, just snack breakfast cakes, fruit, and coffee/juice.   The rooms seemed clean, not badly dated either, and I felt safe staying in this hotel.   It is literally on the corner of California adventure.   It was a little bit of a walk to get to Disneyland, but not bad, and definitely saved the cost of parking at the park.   Closer than many of the other hotel property's even those associated with Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for leaving us the comment of your stay. We strive to keep our rate competitive and still provide great serevice.   In the case of rate, please check both the hotel and internet for the best deal. Thank you for staying with us and we look forward to serving you the next time you visit Anaheim.  Warmest regards, Judy Pao Manager of Alpine Inn

Summary: Lets get the not so good out of the way first.  Parking was absolutely chaos.  If you have a large vehicle, good luck with manuevering around the parking area.  We were lucky that we spent 3 days at Disneyland and walked, but the one day we we left the facility upon return it was mayhem.  The evening staff needs to provide better customer service.  It was as if we were putting him out when we asked questions.  Even on the morning we left, there was not a thank you or come back soon.  That was dissappointing. The room was large enough and very clean.  The remote was really cool (first time I have seen one like that).  I had to adjust the setting on the refridgerator, but once the temp was set all was well.  For the amount of people at the location, it was pleasantly quiet.  The
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Please accept my apology for my staffs lack of courteous service.   I must admit that our parking is tight. At your next visit, please let the front desk staffs know before removing your car off the lot for the day, we will be more than happy to block the  space for you.  Thank you for your review and it will help us to better service during your next stay.  Warmest regards, Judy Pao Manager of Alpine Inn

Summary: This was our third time at the Alpine Inn and it remains our hotel of choice when it comes to visiting Disneyland.   There are now shutters in the room - they look great and prevent light from entering the room. We stayed elsewhere (chain) in Orange County the night before we came to Disney and I can truly say that Alpine Inn won in a side by side comparison. Plenty of towels, clean sheets and space.   We traveled with a toddler this time and we will be returning the next time we come to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for your kind review and I am pleased to learn that you are one of our regulars. Next time when  you visit us, your room will have new LCD TV, carpet and wall decors for your enjoyment.  Warmest regards, Judy Pao Manager of Alpine Inn

Summary: We decided to choose the Alpine Inn in Anaheim, CA because of many of the positive reviews read on Trip Advisor.  We had a great experience at this hotel.  It was within walking distance of Disneyland.  The rooms were very clean.  The free parking, room refrigerator and free breakfast were added bonuses.  In addition to the great facility the customer service was excellent.  The front desk clerks knew our names and greeted us each morning.  Also, upon arriving home, we realized that our son had forgotten his souvenir from Disneyland.  I tried calling the theme park to order a new one but had no luck.  I thought it was a long shot, but I called the hotel manager and asked if they had found the toy.  A few days later I received a call that my son's item was in the mail.  I would
Manager Response: Dear guest,  I am so pleased to know that you had a great stay with us while visiting Disneyland, The Happiest Place on Earth. We are glad that we were able to make your stay comfortable and restful. Please do visit us again.  Warmest regards, Judy Pao Manager of Alpine Inn

Summary: We visited Disneyland with our two teen daughers the first week of June and stayed at the Alpine Inn. This is an older hotel but very well maintained and very clean which is in my opinion the most important thing! The walk back to the hotel was a little hard the first day but we waited too long to come home for our afternoon nap so it was mostly our fault! The beds were comfortable and the mini fridge and microwave came in handy. Yes the carpets are old, bring socks! The morning breakfast is mostly packaged granola bars, packaged donuts, cereal, coffee and juice, however there was fresh fruit. Our family packed the items for a mid morning snack as we are not really breakfast eaters. If you are looking for eggs and waffles or bagles and cream cheese you will be dissapointed. I
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for leaving us the review. Since your stay, we have installed new carpeting in more than half of our rooms and will complete by the end of summer. Also, we pressure wash our parking twice a week to insure the new carpeting will be kept clean.   You are correct about notifying the front desk upon departing from the property to be sure the room is cleaned before you return. Our housekeeping always clean the check out room first before stay over rooms are cleaned.  I am happy that your overall stay was pleasant, please visit us again soon.  Best regards, Judy Pao Manager of Alpine Inn

Summary: The Alpine Inn is importantly less than 15 minutes walk to the entrance of Disneyland. The staff were welcoming and the rooms were more than adequate with a fridge and microwave included. There were places to eat nearby but you could order pizza delivery if you didn't want to venture out!
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for leaving us your review. We value the feedbacks from all of guests. The positive ones always motivate us to continue our great service and constantly look for new ways to improve. Thank you again.  Warmest regards, Judy Pao Manager of Alpine Inn

Summary Heading: Great value for room and location
Summary: short walk  to Disneyland  park. Staff very helpful and friendly.rooms were good.The only thing I noticed is that the carpet needed to be cleaned. If walked on the carpet  your feet would be black. Otherwise great room for the price and location.
