Manager Response: Dear guest,  I am glad that you had a good stay with us.   Since your departure, we have installed new carpeting in over 60% of rooms and will complete by the end of summer. When you visit us the next time, you may walk on the new carpet bare foot comfortable. Thank yo and look forward to serving you again.  Warmest regards, Judy Pao Manager of Alpine Inn

Summary Heading: Simple, clean, and close to the parks
Summary: This place is a holdover from a bygone era when the hotels near Disneyland also themed themselves. Unfortunately, only the main entrance seems to still have the Alpine theme going on. The rest of the property was just a good, basic motor lodge.  We stayed two nights, and it was close enough that we could leave the park mid-day for a nap at the motel, then return for the evening parade and a couple more rides.   About a 15 minute walk each way from the motel to the park entrances.  Best thing was free parking. Overall Alpine Inn was also plenty comfortable and served it's pupose.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for leaving us your review. By looking at your profile, you are a frequent traveler and glad to know that we have met your satisfaction. Please do visit us again on  your next trip to Disneyland. Thank you again.  Warmest regards, Judy Pao Manager of Alpine Inn

Summary: The location was perfect for walking to Disneyland & Anaheim garden walk. Several restaurants within walking distance too. Rooms were cozy & clean. Office staff was very helpful. Good continental breakfast! Would definitely consider staying here again.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  I am glad that we were able to offer you a comfortable stay after a whole day at Disneyland. With less than 15 minutes easy walk, our guests are able to come back to take a nap during mid-day before head back for more fun at Disneyland.  Please do come back and visit us again.  Warmest regards, Judy Pao Manager of Alpine Inn

Summary: Great value, some of the reviews online are brutal, everything from bed bugs to very good. First of all you can get bed bugs in 5 star hotels. No hotel is immune to bed bugs.  We booked by calling, king bed 2 adults $69.99 plus taxes ins May 2013.  Check in was courteous and room was basic modern with fridge, microwave and tube TV.  Free wifi.  About a 15-20 min walk to Disneyland, if you are looking to walk less maybe check out the Ramada Maingate (have not stayed there) but noticed it as I walked to and from the Alpine Inn.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for staying with us and I appreciate your comment. We strive for great rate, clean rooms and courteous services. I am glad that you have enjoy your stay. Please do come visit us again in the near future.  Warmest regards, Judy Pao Manager of Alpine Inn

Summary: Room was clean, quiet and nicely appointed.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  Location was perfect for a Disneyland visit--just a 10-15 minute walk from the Disneyland entrance (the building actually borders one end of California Adventure).  We've stayed here many times before, and will do so again.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for continuing to stay with us while visiting Disneyland. We value your patronage and look forward to serving you on your next trip to Anaheim,  Warmest regards, Judy Pao Manager of Alpine Inn

Summary: I loved the location, it was only a 10 minute walk to Disneyland. There were a few restaurants nearby which were also in walking distance which was great. 7eleven was on the corner which was really convenient for us. The room was overall clean, the shower pressure was AWESOME. A hot steaming shower after a long day at Disneyland was so necessary. The tub was clean (my friend wiped it down with clorox wipes that we brought and the wipes were still white and clean). The usedtobewhitebutnotanymore stool that was in the corner of our bathroom looked a bit gross though. They should get rid of it! There's a fridge and microwave which was great, definitely made use of the fridge. Our only complaints were that the door didn't have a double lock, and the thin blue blankets that were on
Manager Response: Dear guest,  You are certainly correct on our location. We are easy 10-12 minutes to Disneyland and directly across the street from the Anaheim Convention Center. For both business or pleasure, we are situated conveniently.  In regard to the stool, I will personally work with housekeeping and maintenance today to remedy the problem. Thank you and look forward to serving you again.  Warmest regards, Judy Pao Manager of Alpine Inn

Summary: Great walking distance to Disneyland, a 10min walk there. May be a little further if you have small children. Close enough to pop home if you need a cardigan or a short rest from the fun of disneyland. Rooms spacious and very clean. Pool on site. Breakfast nothing great but there's a seven eleven just a few minutes away on the way to Disneyland and a Denny's close by where we grabbed breakky. Would recommend here and would stay here again in future
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for your kind comment. I am glad that you had fun while visiting Disneyland and certainly look forward to serving you again in the near future.  Warmest regards, Judy Pao Manager of Alpine Inn

Summary: I do have to say, the location of this hotel makes it so very worth it to book here.  We walked to the park 4 times during our 2 day stay and it only took 10-12 minutes. It's a good value and the rooms are comfortable.  I do see other folks saying it's clean, and that's the one thing I felt lacked in our room.  It's the little things that matter in good housekeeping.  Just making sure all the door jambs aren't dirty, stains on the walls near the toilet could have been wiped off so I wouldn't automatically think it's poo.  We did utilize the pool and that area was nice and clean, just wish the room had a little more attention paid to it.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for your review. I appreciate the positive comments but value the negative comment more. Because it will help us to serve our guests better when they visit the Happiest Place on Earth. I will certainly consult with the head of housekeeping to make sure that all areas of the rooms will be cleaned. Thank you and hope you will visit us again.  Warmest regards, Judy Pao Manager of Alpine Inn

Summary: The Alpine Inn was a convenient and inexpensive choice directly across from the convention center and so close to Disneland you can hear the screams from kids on the rides, literally. Walking into the park is possible but not super easy because the entrance is some distance away.   The rooms are decent sized, clean and with newer furnishings.  The pool is stuck in the middle of the parking lot and definitely on the small side.    Overall, the property is a great value.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for your comment and we look forward to serving you on your next trip to Anaheim.  Best regards, Judy Pao

Summary: We stayed here in Feb last month for two nights.  We enjoyed being so close to Dland and I was slightly concerned about being directly behind Carsland but there was minimal noise that is only heard if the window in your bathroom is open.  Not a problem.  Room was extremely clean and well appointed.  Bathroom was a bit dated but who cares it did its job just fine.  The pool was nice and the property well kept.  Staff was very friendly and announced my name at check in before I said a word.  Very nice ( I wasn't even late or last in).  Definitely a great stay.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave us with your review. I am glad that you had fun at Disneyland and we were able to make your nights restful. Thank you again.  Best regards, Judy Pao

Summary Heading: Did not even stay here and I am unhappy with it!
Summary: We booked Alpine Inn through their website. I then had to cancel the reservation so I called them on the phone and asked to cancel. I gave my name and then the clerk asked a question. As I was answering, he abruptly cut me off and stated that "that needs to be cancelled online". Before I could ask him why, since he had my reservation pulled up, he said "goodbye" and hung up?! I would have gladly cancelled online and would have rebooked with them if the clerk wasn't so rude.  It could be a lovely place for all I know, the price was right and the reviews were all good. But that first impression can not be undone. I quickly took our business elsewhere.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  I remembered that you made a same day cancellation and yet our policy is 48 hours prior to arrival. In the phone call, you claimed that you intended to book reservation in a different city other than Anaheim. My staff cancelled your reservation without a penalty. We have tried our best to accommodate you. Our goal is to provide the best service to our guest and in this case I felt that we had done that for you. I sincerely hope you can understand our position. Thank you for the review.  Best regards, Judy Pao

Summary Heading: Alpine Inn cancelled room due to plumbing issue with basically no help of finding another hotel.
Summary: On the road from Phoenix to Anaheim, I received a call from the Alpine Inn telling me my room was cancelled due to a plumbing issue. The guy offered one hotel two miles away that was about $50/night as an option because he said all the other hotels were booked (weekend convention going on). I asked how nice it could be for $50/night, he hesitated, and said it wasn't a dump. I told him no thanks. This was disappointing as we wanted a hotel within walking distance to Disneyland. I called a few hotels that were indeed booked, but then found the Castle Inn had a room available. It was right near the Alpine Inn. This shows how little effort the Alpine Inn put in to finding me another nearby hotel.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  I truly apologize for all the inconveniences that we have caused. This is not our normal practice. However, there is no excuse for our decision. Please accept my apology again.   Best regars, Judy Pao

Summary: I have stayed at this property both for buisness and family time at Disneyland.  The staff are all very good.  The rooms are very clean.  The parking is free, and it is about a 10 min walk to Disney. The beds are comfy and so are the pillows, this is one of the few places I know i can leave my pillow at home!
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you very much for your kind review. We strive to provide affordable price, best service and amenities. We look forward to your next visit.  Best regards, Judy Pao

Summary Heading: Great Value property but needs to improve record keeping
Summary: We really enjoyed the Alpine Inn on our recent trip to Disneyland. It was very clean, quiet, the beds where comfortable and it was about a 15-20 minute walk to Disneyland. The small microwave and refrigerator were a plus. I also have to comment on the great job by the housekeeping staff. We would return to our room tired every evening after a full day at Disney and the room would be sparkling clean, bed made, extra coffee left. It was really nice.  The reason for the 3 star rating is becasue after we checked out we were charged incorrectly for an additional night stay. The manager was able to correct the charge but I had to jump through a few hoops to make it happen which was an inconvenience. Also the day we checked out there was over $800. in holds on my credit card for a $250
Manager Response: Dear guest,  I am glad that you had a good stay but apologize for the incorrect charge. We strive for accuracy of all payments and have implemented new procedure to ensure this will not happen. Thank you for your review and we look forward to serving you as our guest again.  Best regards, Judy Pao

Summary Heading: So close you can feel it
Summary: Overall a really nice place, nice people good parking and  cute, i would stay here again no problem A great location near to almost everything and east to find would be nice if it had wireless in the rooms fridge and microwave a great plus.if we were going to Disney  I would stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give us your review. You are right on with our location. Adults and  children get really excited when they first arrive to see the back of the new "Carland". I am happy that you had a great stay and look forward to serving you next time you visit Disneyland.  Best regards, Judy Pao

Summary Heading: We always stay at the Alpine Inn! Love it.
Summary: We take an annual trip to Disneyland, and I can recommend the Alpine Inn in very good faith, having stayed here for several times now with my family. It is the best deal for a hotel in Anaheim, period, and is actually within walking distance of the Disneyland entrance, even with tired legs. Also, because it's so close, you can wake up and just get to the gates before the crowds come, in case you ever felt like being the first person onto the Pirates of the Caribbean ride! At night, you can watch the fireworks from your room. There is a corner store adjacent to it that is convenient as well.  The rooms are clean and large, and there is pizza delivery service which is good. The bathrooms are fine. It's a good motel which is cute and feels just slightly retro. It's also
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for your kind comment. We are one the few original properties in the Disneyland Resort still standing. Our personal service, affordable price and the many amenities such as microwave, mini refrigerator and premium cables are bring guests back again and again. Thank you for you patronage and we look forward to see you at your next trip to Anaheim.  Best regards, Judy Pao

Summary: If you're planning to visit disneyland, this is just a perfect place to start. It's only 10mins walking from the main gate. It has a funny exterior (snow in the summer) and an old interior. The staff is very friendly and is taking care. Checkin was no problem. The price is just perfect, its better to spend your money in the park!The motel is just behind the attractions of disneyland so you can get a sneak peak. There are a lot of possibilities for food and some drinks. a great mall is just minutes away. We had a comfortable bed and a clean bathroom. Overall, this is a perfect weekend place for disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you so very much for leaving the review. You are right on the location, the service, the price and the amenities of the room. We would like to welcome you back to visit us again on your next trip to Disneyland. Thank you.  Best regards, Judy Pao

Summary: Spent the weekend at Alpine Inn for the Tinkerbell half-marathon. I couldn't believe the great deal we found for this hotel! Everything was priced much higher, and we were so happy with our overall experience. The room was clean, with comfy beds and pillows. The shower and sink area were also clean, albeit a little outdated, and bath necessities were provided. The in-room fridge was very handy for snacks, water, and sports drinks. The water/pipes were a little loud at times for my liking, but nothing that interrupted our sleep. The friendly and fast check-in and check-out was the icing on the cake (along with the FREE parking!).
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for your review. I am so glad that you had a great stay with us during Tinkerbell Half Marathon. With today's economy, we had set our rate affordable for everyone visiting Disneyland and the Anaheim convention center. Thank you again and we look forward to your next visit to the Anaheim Resort.   Best regards, Judy Pao

Summary: We stayed here for our trip to Disneyland.  Cute exterior. Older property.  The room was clean and in good condition, and the walls must be pretty thick because we never heard a sound from our neighbors.  Very comfy bed.  Reception was efficient and helpful.  There are a few breakfast items in the lobby, but we are not talking anything substantial. There's a fridge in the room so we bought our own breakfast stuff.  The hotel doesn't have a shuttle so we walked to Disneyland.  Not a bad walk in the morning, a little long at midnight!   It's equal distance to the Main Entrance of Disneyland or to the Monorail in Downtown Disney.  Over all, this hotel was a good value.  We have traditionally stayed at a hotel around the corner, but we saved quite a bit of money staying at the
Manager Response: Dear guest,  I am glad that you have stayed with us the last time you visit Disneyland. We offer our guests clean rooms, friendly service and a great rate. Thank you for trying us out and we look forward to your next visit to Disneyland.  Best regards, Judy Pao

Summary: We stayed for five nights at the Alpine Inn, it is a no frills little motel but it was clean, the beds were very comfortable and it was pretty quiet even though the hotel was completely booked out.  We walked to the Disney Parks all three days and although it was a little far (15 minutes with kids in tow) it wasn't horrible.  I would stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for your review. We really enjoyed to serve your and your family during your stay. Mostly glad to hear that you will visit again. We are in the process of changing out the TVs and carpet in the rooms.  I would like to welcome you back to visit us again in the near future.  Best regards, Judy Pao

Summary: Had a 3 night stay and bartered  a late checkout on day 4. Rooms are basic but very clean. Even had a fridge and micro. Staff was very friendly and courteous. Easy walk to Disney. Small heated pool. Breakfast snack items only. Wifi very sporadic. Would stay again for Disney trip. We could hear the Cars ride from our room - not a bad thing since they close by bedtime :)
Manager Response: Dear guest,  I am so glad that you will come back and visit us on your next trip to Disneyland. We are a no frill property but offer great rate, clean rooms, friendly service and a convenient location to Disneyland. Thank you for your review and look forward to serving you in the near future.  Best regards, Judy Pao

Summary: We stayed two nights during the second week of January for a Disney visit. We got a great coupon rate. Our room was on the second floor in the back. It was nicely decorated with a comfortable king-size bed, a large desk and a great easy chair with a pull-out ottoman. The only thing making this room better would be a small table next to this chair. The breakfast snacks were o.k., so was the coffee. It was easy to walk to Disney. There are fast food places just down the road and some good restaurant a little further. We would stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you so very much for your comment. I am very glad to hear that you had a great time while visiting Disneyland. In regard to your comment, I will look into on the side table next to the chair. Thank you again and I look forward to serving you on your next visit to Disneyland.  Best regards, Judy Pao

Summary: We stayed here for one night on Jan, 12, 2013.  We attended a convention at the convention center across the street and didn't want to pay 200.oo + for a hotel room.  From the minute we arrived until we checked out we had wonderful service, a clean, quiet room and no issues (except our room was cold at night but that was our fault - I didn't realize the air conditioner was also a heater - duh on my part!)  The man who checked us in was very friendly and helpful.  Free parking is a great perk too.  Didn't use the pool - though were told it is heated!  Didn't use the free wi-fi.  The continental breakfast is just that - a continental breakfast.  There were granola bars, wrapped doughnuts, sweet rolls and muffins plus coffee, hot chocolate and orange juice,  Just enough to start
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you staying with us during your convention stay. You are right on that we are literally direct across from the Anaheim Convention Center. Our outdoor heated pool is opened year around for the guests to enjoy. I wish to invite you back next time to take a deep and thank you again.  Best regards, Judy Pao

Summary: We've stayed here the last 3 times we were in the area (Disneyland and Convention Center) and here's why:  -Walk to Disney- it's less than a mile to the main gate (pretty close to the distance you will walk from your car to the tram any way, plus it saves you $15 for parking and the headache of the traffic and tram)  -Eat at Tiffy's on your way to DL(corner of Katella and Disneyland drive)- excellent breakfast, friendly service, priced similar to IHOP (there are 2 IHOPS close by as well) save around $3-5 per person compared to DL. Just about everything you'll need (restaurants, bars, convinient stores, etc.) is less than 10 minutes away (walking)  -Affordable- less $$ than most others in the immediate area  -If you end your day at DL with a beer (or 3) you can walk back to your
Manager Response: Dear guest,  I can not state the benefits of staying with the Alpine Inn better. Thank you for your kind review. Everything you have stated are true and we look forward to serving you on your next visit to Disneyland.  Best regards, Judy Pao

Summary: My family has been staying at the Alpine since the early 1990's! It is literally in Disney's California Adventure Park's backyard. Very clean, quiet, and fairly priced. The rooms come with a fridge and a microwave. Ideal for bringing your own snacks on vacation. I love this place!
Manager Response: Dear guest,  I would like to thank you for your patronage over the years. We installed wood shutter in all the rooms last year and plan to replace the carpet and flat screen TV this year. I like to invite you back to enjoy the new amanities. Thank you again.  Best regards, Judy Pao

Summary: We stayed 2 nights at the Alpine Inn for the proximity to Disney and it exceeded my expectations. For the low price that we paid, I was expecting it to be a little dirty or run down, but our room looked like it was recently renovated and was very clean and comfortable. The staff were friendly and let us park there early in the day before we checked in. Parking was free. The wifi was free and fast enough to watch video. We didn't try the breakfast or the pool, but both are available and add to the value. It was quiet in our room. The heater worked well. Great stay! Would definitely recommend.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you so much for your kind words. We strive to provide the best service, amenities at an affordable price. I look forward to serve you again in the near future.  Best regards, Judy Pao

Summary: We chose this motel for it's location and price.  It is a really quick walk to the park from here and you don't have to cross any major roads to get there.  There was some snack breakfast foods by the check-in desk and the clerk was friendly and helpful.    I'm not sure we will stay here again, but finding less expensive options like this motel is what let us to this trip.  I would say it's good to stay here if you're looking for ways to save some money in your trip budget.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  You are right on with our location. It is just a short walk to the main entrance of Disneyland with a 7-11 on the way. There are plenty of restaurant selections in the area to choose from and within 20 minutes driving time are the beautiful beaches, Knott's Berry Farm, Angel Stadium and the Honda Center. I sincerely would like to invite you back the next time you visit Anaheim.

Summary Heading: But Don't Let Average Fool You!
Summary: The Alpine Inn has become my family's go-to spot for trips to Disneyland. Affordable, clean, with a helpful staff and an excellent location, the Alpine Inn is a consistently great choice for a good place to stay when aiming for Disney adventures. The pool is good in summer and the rooms are warm in winter (no joke - last trip was in December of 2012 - it was freezing for Anaheim, anyway).
Manager Response: Dear guest,  I would like to thank you for your review. The Alpine Inn is a no frill property in the Disneyland Resort area. However, we do offer clean rooms with great price and offers amenities such as in room microwave and mini frig, free WiFi, free parking and an outdoor pool that opens year round for the guests to enjoy. Thank you again for your comment and please come visit us soon.

Summary Heading: Great property and exceptional value to walk to the park
Summary: We have annual passes to Disneyland and we have stayed at the Alpine inn four different times in the past few months.  And we are returning next month.  When we go to Disneyland we generally don’t spend much time in the hotel, so we do not need a lot of extra frills and we like something inexpensive and clean.  The Alpine Inn fits the bill.  The hotel is a great value.  It is a short 5 minute walk to the park and there is a 7-11 on the way should you need a quick snack or drink.  There is a nice pool for when my kids want to swim.  The rooms have a mini fridge and microwave which is a nice addition.  Also I love that they do not charge any extra fees for parking or Wifi as many of the other hotels close to the park do.  We have stayed at a multiple other properties in the same
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for your kind review and patronage. I like to offer the best price and services to all our guests. My philosophy is to keep life simple for all. Therefore, the quoted room rate includes all amanities and services except for the tax. This way, the guest will know the cost before arriving. Thank you again and I look forward to serving you in the near future.

Summary: I was worried about the price but both rooms were CLEAN and nicely furnished.  The grounds are well maintined.  The staff was friendly.  We brought our own breakfast since there is a fridge and micro in the rooms. Best of all, location, location, location.  We will not hesitate to book again.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  I am so glad that you have enjoyed your staya nd thank you so very much for your kind comment. My staffs and I are looking forward to your next visit to the Disneyland Resort.

Summary: We've stayed in several of the smaller hotels near Disneyland, and this one is, by far, the best for the price. Clean rooms, nice staff and great location. It's a no frills stay, but if you're in town for Disneyland, you dont need the frills. The place is quiet and comfortable. We've stayed twice and plan to return again next year.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for staying with twice. I absolute in agreement with you that we are greatly located, clean room, helpful staffs and best price in town. We treat all our guests like family and truly want to be a part of your memorable Disney experience. I hope to see you soon. Thank you again.

Summary: As noted by other reviewers, this hotel was adequate for our needs.  We are looking for a reasonably priced hotel within walking distance of Disneyland.  The only thing we really needed was a place to sleep as most of our time was spent at the parks.  This hotel was a place to sleep and not much more.    The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from the gates of the park, which was great because it saved on having to pay to park.  The room was adequately clean.  The bathroom was dingy and needed updating, but the tub, toilet were clean.  The Inn claims to have a continental breakfast, but only pre-wapped muffins, coffee, and tea were available.  It was minimal at best.  Our room had a refrigerator, however, so a quick stop at the convenience store down the street got us everything we
Manager Response: Hello guest,  I would like to thank you for staying with us. Our goal is to provide the best service, clean room and affordable price to our guests. I certainly  will look for areas for improvement because I want our property to be more than just adaquate. Thank you for your valuable review. I look forward to serving you again as our guest in the future.

Summary: Very inexpensive place to stay. Rooms are clean but small for a family of 4.  The breakfast was literally packaged muffins and powdered donuts.  If you could get the chain hotels for close to the same price I'd stay at one of them with a better breakfast. It ended up costing us $40 extra a day because breakfast was not sufficient.   The front desk people were nice, housekeeping was very good. It is a pretty good walk with no shuttle
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give us your valuable review. I will certainly search the options on breakfast. We strive to provide the best value for our guests and hope to see you next time. Thank you again.

Summary: The title of this review says it all.  There is nothing at all special about the Alpine Inn, but if you're like us, and just want somewhere adequate to sleep, because you're going to be at The Parks all day anyway, this motel is just fine.    The room itself was small and very average, particularly the back bathroom portion, which seemed at or below the level of a Motel 6 and could definitely use some repair/updating.    However, my wife and I knew we would only be sleeping there, and just wanted something within walking distance of the parks.  California Adventure literally backs onto this motel (you can see the backside of the Cars Land mountains from the motel parking lot), and it was a 15 minute walk to the main gates of both parks, without ever having to cross a street, and
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for leaving us with your comment. We are back against the California Adventure Park and it is exciting for the guests to have this feeling of their Disney experiences have begun. The amenities that we offer are free parking, in room microwave, mini frig, premium cable with HBO and complimentary breakfast are all the conveniences for all guests. On the issue of our bathroom, I will work with my maintenance crews and hope to improve the condition. Again thank you.

Summary: Located just beyond the Mountain Range from Radiator Springs, it's the perfect motel to experience Disneyland . It is almost an original motel , it was built in the late 50's ...  There is very light complimentary breakfast, coffee , fruitjuice and some pre packed muffins, waffles , etc ... just enough to kick off your day ... I checked in around noon without any problem, left the car on the parking and ran to Disneyland ! I stayed for 5 nights , the only thing i didn't have the time to enjoy was the pool , opening time was almost the same as the parks.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  I am so glad that you find our property to be different from all the big boxes properties in the area. We would like to keep the friendly setting, cleans rooms and affordable price. Thank you for taking the time to leave us your comment and we look forward to seeing you the next time you visit this area.

Summary: This Hotel was a pleasant surprise. We have driven past it for years and didn't even think about staying there however they had good rates when we went so we thought we would try it. It looks old from the outside but the rooms were nice. The floors had some creeks but heck I'm old and I creek too! I will stay there again if given the chance. They have free parking which is nice. Thanks for making it a good trip.
Manager Response: Dear guest, I am so glad that you have decided to stop in and gave us a try on your last visit to Disneyland. You are correct that many of our guests were surprise after checking out our rooms. Afforddable price, clean room, personal attention and great service set us apart from many of the larger properties in the area. Thank you again for the opportunity to serving you and look forward to seeing you in the near future.

Summary Heading: Just wanted a clean and close hotel in Anaheim
Summary: We were recently on a road trip from Vancouver, BC and used Trip Advisor to find a place to stay near Disneyland. We have been to Disneyland quite a few times over the last 35 years and find it hard to be in California and not go to Disneyland. We were planning to only go for 1 day so we needed a hotel for 2 nights. Alpine Inn had quite good reviews and was very reasonable for Disneyland area. We were pleanantly surprised with our room. Very clean and well equiped with a fridge and microwave. Not fancy but it was nice. Free parking and a 12 minute walk from door to Disneyland gate. We would stay there again and would recommend it.
Manager Response: Dear guest, I am so glad that we are able to accommodate you on your trip to California and Disneyland, Thank you for your kind comment and we strive to provide the best service at affordable price to all our guests at this difficult economically time. I hope to see you on your next trip to California.

Summary: My family of 4 stayed at this motel in October.  We had a very last minute opportunity to go to Disneyland & they still had availability.  We appreciated the free parking, microwave & refrigerator.  The room was clean upon arrival, and cleaned well daily.  It's not a fancy place, but we just needed a nightly home-base.   We brought a stroller for the 5 year old, but the 9 year old handled the 15 min. walk easily.  It's convenient to pass a 7-11 each day too! Breakfast at the motel is just packaged carbs, but we had brought breakfast so our kids could start the day early & well fed.  For $90/night, it was a pretty good deal.
Manager Response: Hello guest,  I appreciate your business and thank you for choosing us for your last minute decision to visit Disneyland. On the issue of breakfast, I will look into our current offering and see how I can add healthier choices. Thank you again and I look forward to seving again in the future.  Best regars, Judy Pao

Summary: Was going to book a package deal from triple AAA but found based on yelp and tripadvisor many of the motels near disney were very low rated.  Went to tripadvisor and found the alpine inn and decided to take a chance, based on the many positive reviews.  Yes the property is a bit old, and yes the breakfast was just some granola bars and juice, but other than that what a nice little motel.  The room was clean, the ac worked great and we slept like babies.  The staff at the front desk was very helpful and friendly.  We are New Yorkers originally and like to walk so we found the 15 minute walk to Disney quite pleasant.  Yeah there are probably motels slightly closer and some may have a shuttle, but we like to walk and found the 15 minute walk easy and did it all three nights there
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for your kind review, Since your departure, we have installed wood shutter in all of the rooms thus the rooms look a lot more modern, cleaner and spacious. Also, we are planning to install new carpet in the near future. I truly look forward to having you visit us again. Thank  you.  Best regards, Judy Pao

Summary Heading: Hotel does not honour your reservation (if you got a good deal)
Summary: Hi,  I was supposed to stay in this hotel starting tomorrow, for a conference taking place in Disneyland Hotel. I did my reservation more than 2 months ago, for a very good price of US $85 after taxes!  However, just about 40min ago, I received an e-mail from them telling me that my reservation was CANCELED, with NO EXPLANATION WHATSOEVER. The very minute I received the e-mail I called them, and the guy that answered could just tell me that my card was rejected and thus "the system" automatically canceled my reservation. I argued a little bit, saying that the card used was a company card that for sure was good to be charged, but trying to solve my problem quickly, I just asked what solution could he offer me, given the situation.  He simply put me on hold, and then came back
Manager Response: Dear guest,   I am sorry that the incident happened. However I need to explain our reservation policy. It is 48 hours prior to the arrival, we authorize the first night plus tax on the credit card in our system. Without an authorization, the reservation is not honored at the property. However, we always give the guest a courtesy call or email. In your case, we do not a contact phone number and an email was sent.   This property is one of the original property in the Disney Resort area. We have been around for a long time and do not cancel any reservation for no reason. I like to apologize for this bad experience and hope you can give us another chance the next time you visit Anaheim. Please contact me personally at 714-535-2186 and I will do my best to assist you.   Best regards, Judy Pao

Summary: My sister and I had a great stay at the Alpine Inn at Anahiem CA. The rooms were clean and comfortable. We were pleased to see a microwave, fridge and coffee maker in the room. The walk to Disneyland was an easy 15 minutes. We stayed until the park was closed and still felt safe walking back to the Inn. The front desk help were very friendly and helpful with our questions.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for taking time from your busy schedule to leave us your kind comment. I am glad that you felt safe while visiting Disneyland Resort. We all have to thank the Disney security and the Anaheim Police. I am very fortunate to have the best staffs working in the office and cleaning the rooms. All of them put their personal care into this property. Providing best service and clean room are our top proprity. I hope to see you and your sister on your next trip to Anaheim and thank you again for the comment.

Summary: We just returned from staying 6 days at the Alpine Inn at Anahiem CA. The hotel was very clean, beds comfortable and pillows were plenty. There was as a fridge,microwave and coffee maker. The breakfast was only coffee and packaged donuts but sometimes that all you want. There were two IHOP's and a Denny's near by so you really don't need the hotels breakfast. For the price of the hotel who cares really!!!! It takes approx. 10-15 min to walk to Disneyland not bad. if someone is with you that can't walk you can always drop them off. I would so recommend this hotel. The price was great and the service was really good. If you are hesitant don't be, you will be pleasantly surprised.
Manager Response: Dear Cheryl and Henry,  Thank you for your comment. We at Alpine Inn do strive for great service, clean room and affordable rate. I am so happy that you had a great time visiting Disneyland area while staying with us and hope to see you soon. Thank you again.

Summary: Just 15 min walking distance to Disneyland. The room is equipped with Microwave oven and Refrigeratory. Clean and comfortable bed.  Very budget breakfast, I would like to buy bread and sandwichs in nearby 7-eleven.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give us your review. You are correct that our best asset is the location. Situated on the same campus as Disneyland resort and right behind the brand Carsland. Many of guests get excited as soon as they arrive at our property. Thank you again for your kind comment and we look forward to serving you the next time you visit the States.

Summary Heading: Alpine Inn in Anaheim, better than the expensive ones...
Summary: I visited recently Alpine Inn in Anaheim, CA in last October 2012 and I only have to say that I exceeded my expectations, don´t let your self be mislead by appareances, the hotel is very comfortable and the rooms are always clean, no humidity smells (that was what I was looking for), it is neighbor with Disneyland ! and you can go walking in 5 minutes, and have to mention, reception staff (Rudy, Aroshe and Aaron) are very kind people and very helpful, no matter where are you from (I´m mexican) and our visit to this hotel was very pleasant, I went with my family and the hotel keeps very calm at night, is not noisy (even when there would be meaby kids because of Disney).  This review is real, I have been in 5 Stars hotels including Sheraton and Hilton and we are fussy people whit
Manager Response: Hello Mr. Gerardo V,  Thank you so very much for your kind comment. You are correct that I do have the best staffs both in the office and in the rooms. This is because we want to make your Disney trip memorable. When you return the next time that you will be pleasant surprise with the new wood shutter that we will install at the beginning of next room, thus the romm will look more updated and cleaner. We look forward to serving again in the near future. Thank you again.

Summary: We stayed at the Alpine Inn for four nights.  It was meant as a base for seeing LA but with the traffic was actually a little bit too far out. For families visiting Disney it was perfect. However the Inn could not be faulted.  Our room was large, immaculate and cleaned daily.  The pool was clean and inviting as well.  Breakfast was average but being free couldn't really complain.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind comment and sorry that you had to experience the hectic LA traffic. But glad that you had a good stay with us and hope to see you on your next visit to Disneyland. Thank you again.

Summary: The air conditioner did not work and the room smelled like mold.  The shower area was dirty and the there was no hot water the last morning we were there.  Extremely disappointing and would not stay there again.
Manager Response: I am so sorry that your stay was unpleasant. In regard to the A/Cs, we are deep cleaning each unit with hose to flush out the entire system to ensure that does not happen in the future. On the issue with hot water, we had a leak in our boiler system and had to repair in recent days. I made sure that we had hot water on until noon. If it had caused any inconvenience. I apologize. Please call me at 800-772-4422 for me to personally thank you for your comment and hope you can give us another try. Thank you for your value review.  Judy Pao

Summary: My husband and I stayed two nights while in town for a baseball game, only about 2.5 miles to Angel stadium. Very close to Disney easily walkable. Also close to many resturants. Rooms were super clean as was the pool and parking lot. Inn backs to Disney so you can hear screams from the coasters, not to loud though. Friendly clerk at check in. Good lodging at a great price.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for your kind comment. We strive to provide great rate, clean room and best service to all of our guests. Ourlocation is our best asset, 15 minutes walking distance to Disneyland, right across from Anaheim Convention Center and 5 minutes drive to the Angel Stadium and Honda Center. Thanks again for staying with us and we look forward to serving you again as our guest.

Summary Heading: Receptionist saved the day for us
Summary: We pre-booked a room back in March to arrive in July, but when we did actually arrive I was told that the booking was for June, and it was flagged as a no show, hence our credit card was charged.  Luckily there was a family room still available and Rudi, the receptionist consulted his boss and then agreed to transfer the booking to the date that we actually arrived.  The room and hotel was acceptable for price and it was a short walk away from Disney.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My wife, daughter,granddaughter and myself stayed here for 3 nights. Its a nice motel but a little old. Rooms are a little small but really CLEAN and thats the main thing.We have stayed at newer hotels and sometimes they are dirty.HIgh prices don't mean great rooms. We did not use the pool but it looked great, water really clear & clean. The bathrooms need a upgrade. replace the shower heads, need newer towels. We will stay here again in December for sure. Can't beat the price and location. Clean, quiet, comfortable & safe.
Manager Response: none

Summary: If going to Disney, it is a great place to stay for the price.  Only a 12-18 min brisk walk to the gate of Disney (and we had 3 children ages 10, 8 & 6)  Very clean w/ the exception of the bathroom floors & the carpet seemed to have been recently cleaned.  The WIFI is horrible. Free breakfast is pre-packaged donuts, muffins, granola bars & coffee.  The cleaning staff did an excellent job tidying up while we were out.  One of the reception employees was not very friendly but another one was great.  So, it just depends on who helps you.  All-in-all a decent experience.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here four nights in June and it is not the greatest place to stay. You really do get what you pay for here, the good - close to Disneyland, walkable, close to a variety of eating places but thats the only good, the bad - unhelpful staff, terrible breakfast, old out of date bath area and terrible towels. One last good point would be the laundry on site, which was very convenient but really i would not stay here again, the staff know very little about the surrounding area, bus routes etc, we were lied to regarding our credit card payment and the staff member involved or management never apologised or bothered to come and discuss this with us.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My partner and I stayed at the Alpine Inn for 6 nights in June 2012.  We paid the AAA rate of $89 per night, which was bargain.  Our room –with two queen beds - was small but comfortable, clean and quiet.  The bathroom was basic but clean; the sink area is separated from the tub and toilet, which is convenient for families.  The beds were fairly comfortable. The air conditioning unit was loud, so we turned it off when we went to bed. The motel staff is very friendly and accommodating. The light continental breakfast included coffee and tea, granola bars and juice.  We kept additional food and beverages in our room, which had a mini-fridge and microwave.  We used the motel’s washer and dryer, which both worked very well. The on-site parking was free and safe.  This older property
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very nice family owned hotel. Wonderful staff,clean comfortable and quiet. Didn't use the pool (where's the time for that when you are at Disney???) small and clean. Quick walk to the parks so you don't have to wait for shuttle busses. Would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: As most others have commented, this property is very convenient to the Park, Convention Center, and Downtown Disney. The rooms are clean, comfortable, and pretty quiet. Technically it's more of a motel than an inn, but I've no complaints at all!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was my second stay within two months. I stayed for two nights and had no major issues. When I booked my room I asked for upstairs and request was met by hotel management. When I checked in I asked Judy, who is the Manager, if I could leave my car parked for a few hours after checkout to participate in a wedding proposal. They checked their booking schedule and I was able to leave me car till 2 PM. I know this can change on how busy they are so make sure to check with them if you need to leave you car after checkout.   Now things I would love this nice hotel to change in the near future: 1) upgrade rooms to LED TVs  2)thicker/upgraded comforters  3)a bathroom rewriting as switches in my room did not work.  4)Expand Breakfast food offerings.add cold cereal cups,hot
Manager Response: none

Summary: I'd always wanted to stay at the Alpine Inn.  The fake snow along the roof line - it just enchanted me when I was a child.  The location is convenient to the Maingate.  Not super close, but close enough.  We had no complaints about this hotel.  The room was clean, the bed comfortable, the staff friendly and the free parking was very nice.  This isn't a fancy place, but it's kept in great shape and we were very happy with our hotel choice.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Extremely great value and close to disneyland
Summary: Stayed here with my wife and kid. They never stopped working!  Everything was immaculate and they loved playing with the baby !  Restaurants were very close and the 7-11 was a block away.  We didn't have a car but there was lots of parking.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us on your recent visit and sharing your comments with fellow travelers. I am delighted that you and your family enjoyed the stay in our two bedroom family room with 3 queen beds. Please feel free to contact us when returning as it would be our pleasure to assist with rates and reservations. Best regards!

Summary: We booked the Alpine Inn after reading Trip Advisors reviews and Disneyland discussion board reviews.  The beds were comfortable, each bed had 4 pillows, and the linens were nicer and smelled so fresh and CLEAN.  The bathroom had newly caulked corners and edges, was completely mildew free, and the towels also smelled very fresh and clean.  The sink was sparkling with granite, and the fridge and microwave were newer and worked perfectly.  The room didn't have any weird smells like a lot of motel rooms, and everything was replaced daily and housekeeping did an excellent job.  The carpets were clean as well.  Our TV worked fine, A/C worked well, and we never had a problem with upstairs noise or noise from the parking lot.  The room felt large, and has a desk, entertainment hutch,
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share with the TripAdvisor readers your comments. I was delighted to read that you enjoyed your stay with us. If you want fancy and co$ly.....look elsewhere .

Believe me, if you're looking for a clean place with free wi-fi, free parking, and free food in the morning, you're not going to find a better place.  Last BlizzCon, we stayed at the Hilton and ended up paying over $700 for three days (parking and wi-fi were extra and the entire place was loud and crowded).  We paid just above $400 at Alpine Inn. Summary: Stayed in the Alpine Inn for 4 nights when visiting Disneyland. Anyone who believes this motel is a long walk from Disneyland must be so lazy it's not funny. 5 minute walk with two young children. Sure there are closer hotels, however the Alpine was definately close enough, and had the advantage of being right next to a 7/11 so we were able to buy cereals and fruit etc for breakfast. Room was clean, spacious and serviced everyday. Also had a microwave and fridge so we were able to save a bit of money on breakfast and not have to eat (vomit) Denny's more than once. There is a pool but we didn't use it.

To the west and back (north) of Alpine Inn is Disneyland itself, but the entrances to Disneyland are about a 10-15 minute walk away.  I prefer the quiet rooms at the back side of Alpine Inn, away from the busy street (although there is construction in Disneyland near the back of Alpine Inn). Back in the old days it was right by the main entrance however due to the opening of Disney California one now needs to take a tram to get tho the park or walk about 30min. If you are looking ofr a good value & Old School Disney nestalgia the Alpine Inn is a great place to stay.
